member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.ConvertAMPUICodeForTokenCmdlet
member.summary: Exchanges an access code for a token.

para.para: The access code to send in the request.
The third-party provider for the token. The only valid value is figma.
The location of the application that will receive the access code.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.ConvertAMPUICodeForTokenCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AmplifyUIBuilder.Model.ExchangeCodeForTokenResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AmplifyUIBuilder.Model.ExchangeCodeForTokenResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.ConvertAMPUICodeForTokenCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Provider parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Provider' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.ConvertAMPUICodeForTokenCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.ExportAMPUIComponentCmdlet
member.summary: Exports component configurations to code that is ready to integrate into an Amplify app.

para.para: The unique ID of the Amplify app to export components to.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
The token to request the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.ExportAMPUIComponentCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Entities'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AmplifyUIBuilder.Model.ExportComponentsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AmplifyUIBuilder.Model.ExportComponentsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.ExportAMPUIComponentCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

The token to request the next page of results.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Entities'. member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.GetAMPUIComponentCmdlet
member.summary: Returns an existing component for an Amplify app.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.GetAMPUIComponentCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Component'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AmplifyUIBuilder.Model.GetComponentResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AmplifyUIBuilder.Model.GetComponentResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.GetAMPUIComponentCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Id parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Id' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.NewAMPUIComponentCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a new component for an Amplify app.

para.para: The unique ID of the Amplify app to associate with the component.
The data binding information for the component's properties.
A list of child components that are instances of the main component.
The data binding configuration for customizing a component's properties. Use this for a collection component.
The component type. This can be an Amplify custom UI component or another custom component.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
The event configuration for the component. Use for the workflow feature in Amplify Studio that allows you to bind events and actions to components.
The name of the component
Describes the component properties that can be overriden to customize an instance of the component.
Describes the component's properties.
The schema version of the component when it was imported.
The unique ID of the component in its original source system, such as Figma.
One or more key-value pairs to use when tagging the component data.
A list of the unique variants of this component.
The unique client token.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.NewAMPUIComponentCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Entity'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.AmplifyUIBuilder.Model.CreateComponentResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.AmplifyUIBuilder.Model.CreateComponentResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.AMPUI.NewAMPUIComponentCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Describes the button's properties.
The data source type, either an Amplify DataStore model or a custom data type.
The unique name of the data type you are using as the data source for the form.
The name of the backend environment that is a part of the Amplify app.
Specifies whether the button is visible on the form.
Specifies whether the button is visible on the form.
Specifies whether the button is visible on the form.
The configuration information for the form's fields.
The field position is fixed and doesn't change in relation to other fields.
The field position is fixed and doesn't change in relation to other fields.
The field position is fixed and doesn't change in relation to other fields.
Specifies whether to perform a create or update action on the form.
The name of the form.
The position of the button.
The field position is to the right of the field specified by the string.
The field position is to the right of the field specified by the string.
The field position is to the right of the field specified by the string.
The schema version of the form.
The configuration information for the visual helper elements for the form. These elements are not associated with any data.
One or more key-value pairs to use when tagging the form data.
A reference to a design token to use to bind the form's style properties to an existing theme.
A reference to a design token to use to bind the form's style properties to an existing theme.
A reference to a design token to use to bind the form's style properties to an existing theme.
The value of the style setting.
